source_text: At least quarterly, [The Organization] reviews shall be performed with approved documented specification to confirm personnel are following security policies and operational procedures pertaining to:  • log reviews • firewall rule-set reviews • applying configuration standards to new [The Organization] • responding to security alerts • change management processes
target_text: The service provider must document the operating procedures, keep them up to date and make them accessible to the staff concerned.

source_text: A three-year audit program is in place which defines the scope and frequency of audits in accordance with change management, policies, and risk assessment results.
target_text: The service provider must document and implement an audit program over three years defining the perimeter and frequency of audits in accordance with change management, policies, and the results of risk assessment. The service provider must include in the audit program an audit qualified per year carried out by an audit provider for qualified information systems [PASSI]. The entire audit program must in particular cover: - the audit of the configuration of the technical infrastructure of the service. This audit is carried out by sampling and must include all types of equipment and servers present in the service information system; - the intrusion test of administration interfaces exposed on a public network; - the Intrusion test of the user interface for SaaS services; - If the service benefits from internal developments, the source code audit relating to the security functionalities implemented (the continuous approach must be favored). IT service providers in clouds (SecnumCloud) - Date Date Version References Dispute Criterion Page

source_text: Legal and regulatory requirements regarding cybersecurity, including privacy and civil liberties obligations, are documented and maintained by Systems  legal department on an annual basis.
target_text: The service provider must identify the legal, regulatory and contractual requirements in force applicable to the service. In France, the service provider must at least consider the following texts: - personal data [law_il], [GDPR]; - professional secrecy [CP_ART_226_13], if necessary without prejudice to the application of article 40 paragraph 2 of the Code of Criminal Procedure relating to the report to a judicial authority; - breach of trust [CP_ART_314-1]; - the secret of private correspondence [CP_ART_226-15]; - involvement of privacy [CP_ART_226-1]; - fraudulent access or maintenance to an information system [CP_ART_323-1].

source_text: Legal and regulatory requirements regarding cybersecurity, including privacy and civil liberties obligations, are documented and maintained by Systems  legal department on an annual basis.
target_text: The service provider must document and implement the procedures to comply with the legal, regulatory and contractual requirements in force applicable to the service, as well as specific security needs (see requirement 8.3b)).

source_text: Legal and regulatory requirements regarding cybersecurity, including privacy and civil liberties obligations, are documented and maintained by Systems  legal department on an annual basis.
target_text: The service provider must document and implement a process of active monitoring of the legal, regulatory and contractual requirements in force applicable to the service.

source_text: A documented business continuity/disaster recovery (BC/DR) plan is in place and tested at least annually. Enterprise testing is done by the IT Risk Management Team. Offer teams perform testing for their given offers. Any exclusions are documented as part of the BC/DR plan. As part of the BC/DR plan, management identifies rooms for improvement and implements necessary actions to improve their business continuity plan as well.
target_text: The service provider must define and document derogatory physical access measures in an emergency.

source_text: A documented business continuity/disaster recovery (BC/DR) plan is in place and tested at least annually. Enterprise testing is done by the IT Risk Management Team. Offer teams perform testing for their given offers. Any exclusions are documented as part of the BC/DR plan. As part of the BC/DR plan, management identifies rooms for improvement and implements necessary actions to improve their business continuity plan as well.
target_text: The service provider must define and document derogatory physical access measures in an emergency.

source_text: A documented business continuity/disaster recovery (BC/DR) plan is in place and tested at least annually. Enterprise testing is done by the IT Risk Management Team. Maintenance records are stored for the agreed upon time intervals and then properly and permanently destroyed thereafter.

target_text: The service provider must document and implement, for the service information system, the partitioning measures (logic, physics or by encryption) to separate network flows according to: - the sensitivity of the information transmitted; - the nature of the flows (production, administration, supervision, etc.); - the field of belonging of flows (sponsors - with distinction by sponsor or set of sponsors, service provider, third parties, etc.); - The technical field (treatment, storage, etc.).

source_text: An [organization] has a support system to manage customer issues including system information on failures, incidents, concerns, and other complaints.
target_text: The service provider must, at the request of a sponsor, make him accessible the internal regulations and the ethics charter. information

target_text: The provider must, at the request of a sponsor, make him accessible the sanctions incurred in the event of an offense to the security policy.

source_text: An [organization] has a support system to manage customer issues including system information on failures, incidents, concerns, and other complaints.
target_text: The service provider can carry out support operations in the sponsors from a state outside the European Union. He must document the list of operations which can be carried out by the media support from a state outside the European Union, and the mechanisms to ensure access control and supervision from the European Union.

source_text: A data flow diagram is documented and maintained for data that processed (analyzed, stored or transmitted, etc.) within the services' applications and infrastructure network and [The Organization]. The data flow diagram is reviewed at least annually or based on defined frequency of organization policies and any changes are updated in the diagram.
target_text: The provider must distinguish public areas, private areas and sensitive areas.

source_text: A data flow diagram is documented and maintained for data that processed (analyzed, stored or transmitted, etc.) within the services' applications and infrastructure network and [The Organization]. The data flow diagram is reviewed at least annually or based on defined frequency of organization policies and any changes are updated in the diagram.
target_text: The service provider must establish and keep up to date a cartography of the service information system, in connection with the asset inventory (see chapter 8.1), comprising at least the following elements: - The list of material or virtualized resources; - The names and functions of the applications, supporting the service; - the network architecture scheme at level 3 of the OSI model on which the neuralgic points are identified: - interconnection points, in particular with third and public networks, - networks, subnets, in particular administration networks, - equipment providing security functions (filtering, authentication, encryption, etc.), - servers hosting data or ensuring sensitive functions; - The authorized network flow matrix specifying: - their technical description (services, protocols and ports); - business justification or technical infrastructure; - If necessary, when services, protocols or deemed not safe ports are used, the compensatory measures implemented, in the in -depth defense logic.

The data flow diagram is reviewed at least annually or based on defined frequency of organization policies and any changes are updated in the diagram.
target_text: The service provider must revise the cartography at least annually.

source_text: Data classified as Customer Data and any Personal Data attributable to the customer is prohibited from being used or stored in non-production [The Organization] or environments. If Customer Data must be used for staging and research environments, the customer data must be anonymized. If customer data cannot be anonymized, customers shall be notified of such use, and such environments must be protected in accordance with applicable policies and standards for such data.
target_text: Within the framework of technical support, if the actions necessary for the diagnosis and the resolution of a problem encountered by a sponsor require access to the data of the sponsor, then the service provider must: - only allow access to the data of the sponsor only after the explicit consent of the sponsor; - Check that the person to whom access must be authorized has satisfied the checks of the requirement 7.1.B; - In the case of an intervention carried out remotely by a localized person outside the European Union, implement a secure gateway (rebound position) by which the person must connect and allow supervision (authorization or prohibition of actions, requests for explanations, etc.) in real time, by a person who has herself satisfied with the checks of the requirement 7.1.b. The secure gateway will have to respond to cloud computer service providers (SecnumCloud) - Date District version Referential Distribution Critory Safety Objectives2 specified in [G_EXT] Adapted to the context of technical support actions; - Consider the actions carried out, once the access is authorized, as actions of administration and journalist as such; - Delete authorization to access the data of the sponsor at the end of these actions. 2 Safety objectives of the secure gateway [G_EXT]: - authenticate the remote machine and the person in charge of the support; - prevent the exploitation of vulnerabilities or stolen doors on the telemas; - Guarantee the confidentiality and integrity of data on the IS; - Ensure a traceability of confidence of the actions carried out by the technician of the support center; -Guarantee the safety of the telemaintin function vis-à-vis the system subject to teleodiagnostics as well as related systems; - Guarantee the absence of a leak of information outside. IT service providers in clouds (SecnumCloud) - Date Date Version References Dispute Criterion Page

source_text: Data classified as Customer Data and any Personal Data attributable to the customer is prohibited from being used or stored in non-production [The Organization] or environments. source_text: Formal retention and disposal procedures are in place to guide the secure retention and disposal of [The Organization] data.
target_text: The service provider must document and implement a registration and unsubscription procedure for users based on a management and access rights interface. This procedure must indicate which data should be deleted at the start of a user.

source_text: Formal retention and disposal procedures are in place to guide the secure retention and disposal of [The Organization] data.
target_text: The service provider must implement means to ensure that the unsubscription of a user results in the deletion of all his access to the resources of the service system, as well as the deletion of his data in accordance with the registration and unsubscription procedure (see requirement 9.2 a)).

source_text: Formal retention and disposal procedures are in place to guide the secure retention and disposal of [The Organization] data.
target_text: The service provider must document and implement means allowing to erase in a secure manner by rewriting random patterns any data medium made available to a cloud computer service providers (SecnumCloud) - Referential for Date Date Date Criterion Clear. If the storage space is encrypted as part of the requirement 10.1.A), the erasure can be carried out by a secure erasure of the encryption key.

source_text: Electronic media containing confidential information is purged or destroyed in accordance with best practices, and certificates of destruction are issued for each device destroyed.
target_text: The service provider must ensure that the media can only be returned to a third party if the data of the sponsor is stored there in accordance with chapter 10.1 or have been destroyed beforehand using a secure erasure mechanism by rewriting random patterns.

source_text: Customer data containing confidential and personal information is purged or removed from the application environment (including backups and data shared with other Offer/Product) upon customer request according to [The Organization] policy and/or contractual obligations.
target_text: At the end of the contract binding the service provider and the sponsor, whether the contract has come to an end or for any other cause, the service provider must ensure a secure erasure of all of the data from the sponsor. This erasure must be the subject of formal notice to the sponsor on the part of the service provider with a period of twenty -one calendar days. The erasure can be carried out according to one of the following methods, and this within a period specified in the service agreement: - Erasure by complete rewriting of any medium that hosted this data; - Erasure of the keys used for the encryption of the storage spaces of the sponsor described in chapter 10.1; - secure recycling, under the conditions set out in chapter 11.9.

source_text: Customer data containing confidential and personal information is purged or removed from the application environment (including backups and data shared with other Offer/Product) upon customer request according to [The Organization] policy and/or contractual obligations.
target_text: At the end of the contract, the service provider must delete the technical data relating to the sponsor (directory, certificates, configuration of access, etc.).

source_text: Formal retention and disposal procedures are in place to guide the secure retention and disposal of customer and personal data.
target_text: The service provider must take into account in risk assessment: - information management of the sponsor with different security needs; - the risks having impacts on the rights and freedoms of the persons concerned in the event of unauthorized access, unwanted modification and disappearance of personal data; - the risks of failure of the compartmentalization mechanisms of the resources of the technical infrastructure (memory, calculation, storage, network) shared between the sponsors; - the risks linked to the incomplete or unsecured erasure of data stored on memory or storage spaces shared between sponsors, in particular during the reallocations of memory and storage spaces; - the risks linked to the exposure of administration interfaces on a public network; - the risks of infringement of the confidentiality of the data of the sponsors by third parties involved in the provision of the service (suppliers, subcontractors, etc.): - the risks linked to natural and physical claims events; - the risks linked to the separation of tasks (see 6.2.a); - Risks linked to development environments (see 14.4.B). IT service providers in clouds (SecnumCloud) - Date Date Version References Dispute Criterion Page

source_text: Systems must store and process data (including technical data) within the European Union. Furthermore, the administration and supervision of the service must be carried out from the European Union as well.
target_text: The service provider must store and process the data of the sponsor within the European Union.

source_text: Cryptographic key owners must formally acknowledge that they understand and accept their key owner responsibilities upon hire and at least an annual basis thereafter.
target_text: The provider must implement cryptographic keys respecting the rules of [crypto_b2].

source_text: Cryptographic key owners must formally acknowledge that they understand and accept their key owner responsibilities upon hire and at least an annual basis thereafter.
target_text: It is recommended that the provider implementing cryptographic keys respecting the recommendations of [crypto_b2].

source_text: Key management procedures are documented, reviewed at least annually, and define the following processes but not limited to:  -Prevent unauthorized substitution of cryptographic keys -Specify how to generate strong keys -Specify how to securely distribute keys -Requirements for cryptographic key changes for keys that have reached the end of their crypto period -Requirements for retirement or replacement (for example, archiving, destruction, and/or revocation) of keys as deemed necessary when the integrity of the key has been weakened -Store secret and private keys used to encrypt/decrypt data -Securely Store cryptographic keys in the fewest possible locations  Revision histories and review periods are defined within the documents themselves and [The Organization] Policy Governance Policy.
target_text: The service provider must define and implement a encryption mechanism preventing the recovery of the data from the sponsors in the event of the reallocation of a resource or recovery of the physical support. - In the case of an IAAS or CAAS service, this objective may for example be achieved: - by encryption of the disk or file system, when the access protocol in files mode guarantees that only empty blocks can be allocated (for example NAS type storage in which a physical block is actually affected until the time of writing), - by volume encryption in the case of Access in Bloc or Storage local), with at least one key per sponsor; - In the case of a Paa or SaaS service, this objective may be achieved using an application encryption in the perimeter of the service provider, with at least one key per sponsor.

target_text: When the service provider implements an electronic signature mechanism, the latter must respect the rules of [Crypto_B1]

source_text: [The Organization] issues public key certificates under an approved certificate authority or obtains public key certificates from an approved service provider.
target_text: On the technical infrastructure, the service provider must use exclusively public key certificates from a certification authority of a Member State of the European Union (ceremonies of generation of the key keys must take place in a member country of the European Union and in the presence of the service provider). source_text: [The Organization] communicates to its cloud service customers when cryptography is used to protect the customer data and provides information and cryptographic technologies to cloud service customers to use.
target_text: The service provider must partition, physically or by encryption, all internal data flows to the service information system vis-à-vis any other information system. When this partitioning is made by encryption, it is carried out in accordance with the requirements of chapter 10.2.

source_text: [The Organization] communicates to its cloud service customers when cryptography is used to protect the customer data and provides information and cryptographic technologies to cloud service customers to use.
target_text: In the event that the technical infrastructure administration network is not subject to physical partitioning, administration flows must pass through a quantified tunnel, in accordance with the requirements of chapter 10.2.

target_text: The service provider must document and implement an out -of -site transfer procedure of the sponsor, equipment and software. This procedure must require that the service provider will give its written authorization. In all cases, the service provider must implement the means making it possible to guarantee that the level of protection in confidentiality and integrity of assets during their transport is equivalent to that on site.

target_text: When the service provider authorizes a situation of mobility for the administrators under his responsibility, he must supervise it by a documented policy. The solution implemented must ensure that the level of security of this mobility situation is at least equivalent to the level of security outside mobility (see chapters 9.6 and 9.7). This solution must notably include: - the use of a encrypted, non -open and non -circumstances tunnel, for all flows (see chapter 10.2); - Full encryption of the disc (see chapter 10.1).

source_text: Approved cryptographic algorithms and methods are used for securing assets with confidential, personal, and sensitive data both at rest and in-transit over public networks. For NIST, FedRAMP, and CMMC, FIPS 140-2 Cryptography method is used to protect data at rest and in transit.
target_text: The service provider must document and implement an out -of -site transfer procedure of the sponsor, equipment and software. This procedure must require that the service provider will give its written authorization. In all cases, the service provider must implement the means making it possible to guarantee that the level of protection in confidentiality and integrity of assets during their transport is equivalent to that on site.

source_text: Approved cryptographic algorithms and methods are used for securing assets with confidential, personal, and sensitive data both at rest and in-transit over public networks. For NIST, FedRAMP, and CMMC, FIPS 140-2 Cryptography method is used to protect data at rest and in transit.
target_text: When the service provider authorizes a situation of mobility for the administrators under his responsibility, he must supervise it by a documented policy. The solution implemented must ensure that the level of security of this mobility situation is at least equivalent to the level of security outside mobility (see chapters 9.6 and 9.7). This solution must notably include: - the use of a encrypted, non -open and non -circumstances tunnel, for all flows (see chapter 10.2); - Full encryption of the disc (see chapter 10.1).

source_text: Approved cryptographic algorithms and methods are used for securing assets with confidential, personal, and sensitive data both at rest and in-transit over public networks. For NIST, FedRAMP, and CMMC, FIPS 140-2 Cryptography method is used to protect data at rest and in transit.
target_text: The service provider must document and implement, for the service information system, the partitioning measures (logic, physics or by encryption) to separate network flows according to: - the sensitivity of the information transmitted; - the nature of the flows (production, administration, supervision, etc.); - the field of belonging of flows (sponsors - with distinction by sponsor or set of sponsors, service provider, third parties, etc.); - The technical field (treatment, storage, etc.).

source_text: Approved cryptographic algorithms and methods are used for securing assets with confidential, personal, and sensitive data both at rest and in-transit over public networks. For NIST, FedRAMP, and CMMC, FIPS 140-2 Cryptography method is used to protect data at rest and in transit.
target_text: The service provider must partition, physically or by encryption, all internal data flows to the service information system vis-à-vis any other information system. When this partitioning is made by encryption, it is carried out in accordance with the requirements of chapter 10.2.

source_text: Approved cryptographic algorithms and methods are used for securing assets with confidential, personal, and sensitive data both at rest and in-transit over public networks. For NIST, FedRAMP, and CMMC, FIPS 140-2 Cryptography method is used to protect data at rest and in transit.
target_text: In the event that the technical infrastructure administration network is not subject to physical partitioning, administration flows must pass through a quantified tunnel, in accordance with the requirements of chapter 10.2.

source_text: Access to the cryptographic keystores is limited to authorized personnel.
target_text: The provider must protect access to cryptographic keys and other secrets used for data encryption by a suitable means: security container (software or hardware) or disjoint support.

source_text: Access to the cryptographic keystores is limited to authorized personnel.
target_text: The service provider must protect access to cryptographic keys and other secrets used for administration tasks by a suitable security container, software or hardware.

source_text: Where full disk encryption is used, logical access  be managed independently of operating system authentication; decryption keys  not be associated with user accounts.
target_text: The service provider must define and implement a encryption mechanism preventing the recovery of the data from the sponsors in the event of the reallocation of a resource or recovery of the physical support. - In the case of an IAAS or CAAS service, this objective may for example be achieved: - by encryption of the disk or file system, when the access protocol in files mode guarantees that only empty blocks can be allocated (for example NAS type storage in which a physical block is actually affected until the time of writing), - by volume encryption in the case of Access in Bloc or Storage local), with at least one key per sponsor; - In the case of a Paa or SaaS service, this objective may be achieved using an application encryption in the perimeter of the service provider, with at least one key per sponsor.

source_text: Cryptographic keys are invalidated when compromised or at the end of their defined lifecycle period.
target_text: The provider must implement cryptographic keys respecting the rules of [crypto_b2].

target_text: It is recommended that the provider implementing cryptographic keys respecting the recommendations of [crypto_b2].

source_text: All random numbers and other primitives and parameters used are generated using only approved random number generation (RNG) algorithms or libraries. RNG algorithms, libraries and other primitives must be chosen from industry standards.
target_text: The service provider must ensure that the media can only be returned to a third party if the data of the sponsor is stored there in accordance with chapter 10.1 or have been destroyed beforehand using a secure erasure mechanism by rewriting random patterns.

source_text: All random numbers and other primitives and parameters used are generated using only approved random number generation (RNG) algorithms or libraries. RNG algorithms, libraries and other primitives must be chosen from industry standards.
target_text: The service provider must document and implement means allowing to erase in a secure manner by rewriting random patterns any data medium made available to a cloud computer service providers (SecnumCloud) - Referential for Date Date Date Criterion Clear. If the storage space is encrypted as part of the requirement 10.1.A), the erasure can be carried out by a secure erasure of the encryption key.

source_text: Store secret and private keys used to encrypt/decrypt data in one (or more) of the following forms at all times:  -Encrypted with a key-encrypting key that is at least as strong as the data encrypting key, and that is stored separately from the data-encrypting key  -Within a secure cryptographic device (such as a hardware (host) security module (HSM) or PTS-approved point-of-interaction device)  -As at least two full-length key components or key shares, in accordance with an industry accepted method
target_text: The service provider must define and implement a encryption mechanism preventing the recovery of the data from the sponsors in the event of the reallocation of a resource or recovery of the physical support. - In the case of an IAAS or CAAS service, this objective may for example be achieved: - by encryption of the disk or file system, when the access protocol in files mode guarantees that only empty blocks can be allocated (for example NAS type storage in which a physical block is actually affected until the time of writing), - by volume encryption in the case of Access in Bloc or Storage local), with at least one key per sponsor; - In the case of a Paa or SaaS service, this objective may be achieved using an application encryption in the perimeter of the service provider, with at least one key per sponsor.

source_text: A removable media usage policy is developed and implemented.
target_text: The service provider must document and implement a procedure for the management of removable media, in accordance with the need for security defined in chapter 8.3. When removable supports are used on technical infrastructure or for administration tasks, these supports must be dedicated to use. IT service providers in clouds (SecnumCloud) - Date Date Version References Dispute Criterion Page

source_text: Network and system hardening standards are documented and reviewed at least annually. These standards are deployed to all networks and production [The Organization]. Revision histories and review periods are defined within the documents themselves and the [The Organization] Policy Governance Policy.
target_text: The service provider must document and implement a procedure for managing the software environment configuration made available to the sponsor, in particular for their maintenance in security condition.

source_text: Network and system hardening standards are documented and reviewed at least annually. These standards are deployed to all networks and production [The Organization]. target_text: The service provider must provide an inspection and deletion capacity, if necessary, of entrants3 (control of authenticity and the safety of updates, control of the innocent of the tools provided, etc.) relating to the perimeter of the technical infrastructure: 3 The entrants are here made up of the elements necessary and specific to the installation of software considered: software elements to be installed, installation tools provided, etc. Providers of IT services in clouds (SecnumCloud) - Referential of requirements Date Date Criterion Diffusion Page - This inspection and deletion capacity must generate activity logs and must be able to be the subject of an audit of code, - entrants must be treated on specific devices carried out and maintained by the provider and hosted in a partitioned area of ​​the rest of the infrastructure ( demilitarized as defined in [G_INT]).

target_text: The service provider must put in place hardening measures of the configuration of the terminals used for administration tasks, in particular those in chapter 4.2 entitled "Safety of the base" of [nt_admin].

source_text: A documented Information Security Management System Risk Assessment Methodology is in place that includes guidance on the identification of potential threats, rating the significance of the risks associated with the identified threats, and mitigation strategies for those risks, documentation and communication of those risks, as well as possible vulnerabilities within the cloud service provider and their impacts. Upper management, or its designated representative(s), owns this methodology and is responsible for its adherence.
target_text: The service provider must document an assessment of the risks covering the entire perimeter of the service.

source_text: A documented Information Security Management System Risk Assessment Methodology is in place that includes guidance on the identification of potential threats, rating the significance of the risks associated with the identified threats, and mitigation strategies for those risks, documentation and communication of those risks, as well as possible vulnerabilities within the cloud service provider and their impacts. Upper management, or its designated representative(s), owns this methodology and is responsible for its adherence.
target_text: The service provider must carry out its risk assessment using a documented method guaranteeing the reproducibility and comparability of the process.

source_text: A documented Information Security Management System Risk Assessment Methodology is in place that includes guidance on the identification of potential threats, rating the significance of the risks associated with the identified threats, and mitigation strategies for those risks, documentation and communication of those risks, as well as possible vulnerabilities within the cloud service provider and their impacts. Upper management, or its designated representative(s), owns this methodology and is responsible for its adherence.
target_text: The service provider must take into account in risk assessment: - information management of the sponsor with different security needs; - the risks having impacts on the rights and freedoms of the persons concerned in the event of unauthorized access, unwanted modification and disappearance of personal data; - the risks of failure of the compartmentalization mechanisms of the resources of the technical infrastructure (memory, calculation, storage, network) shared between the sponsors; - the risks linked to the incomplete or unsecured erasure of data stored on memory or storage spaces shared between sponsors, in particular during the reallocations of memory and storage spaces; - the risks linked to the exposure of administration interfaces on a public network; - the risks of infringement of the confidentiality of the data of the sponsors by third parties involved in the provision of the service (suppliers, subcontractors, etc.): - the risks linked to natural and physical claims events; - the risks linked to the separation of tasks (see 6.2.a); - Risks linked to development environments (see 14.4.B). IT service providers in clouds (SecnumCloud) - Date Date Version References Dispute Criterion Page

source_text: Risk assessments are performed at least annually. As part of this process, threats and changes (environmental, regulatory, and technological) to service commitments are identified and the risks are formally assessed. The risk assessment includes risk mitigation strategies and acceptance levels based on [The Organization] risk criteria. The risk assessment includes a consideration of the potential for fraud and how fraud may impact the achievement of objectives. The results of the risk assessment are reviewed by leadership at least annually.
target_text: The service provider must document an assessment of the risks covering the entire perimeter of the service.

source_text: Management has established defined roles and responsibilities to oversee the implementation of the security and control environment.

source_text: The Audit Committee is governed by a Charter, is independent from Systems Management, is composed of outside directors (Industry Experts), and meets at least quarterly.  The Audit Committee oversees:  •Financial Statement Quality  •Enterprise Risk Management •Regulatory & Legal Compliance •Internal Audit Functions •Information Security Functions •External Audit Functions
target_text: The service provider must identify the legal, regulatory and contractual requirements in force applicable to the service. In France, the service provider must at least consider the following texts: - personal data [law_il], [GDPR]; - professional secrecy [CP_ART_226_13], if necessary without prejudice to the application of article 40 paragraph 2 of the Code of Criminal Procedure relating to the report to a judicial authority; - breach of trust [CP_ART_314-1]; - the secret of private correspondence [CP_ART_226-15]; - involvement of privacy [CP_ART_226-1]; - fraudulent access or maintenance to an information system [CP_ART_323-1].

source_text: [The Organization] identifies geographies with legal and regulatory risks such as embargoed countries. Systems shall not operate out of, or have administrators that reside in such geographies.

source_text: Roles and responsibilities of the cloud computing customers and service providers are defined and agreed on. Included in the agreement are definitions including but not limited to data ownership, Information Security Accountability,  access provisioning and approval responsibilities, supplier use, and data backup and recovery responsibilities. Management designates stewardship to a person or group of people to govern these agreements.
target_text: The service provider must document and implement an internal security organization to ensure the definition, implementation and monitoring of the operational operation of information security within its organization.

source_text: Management prepares a statement of applicability that includes control objectives, implemented controls, and business justification for excluded controls. Management aligns the statement of applicability with the results of the risk assessment.
target_text: The service provider must establish and keep up to date a cartography of the service information system, in connection with the asset inventory (see chapter 8.1), comprising at least the following elements: - The list of material or virtualized resources; - The names and functions of the applications, supporting the service; - the network architecture scheme at level 3 of the OSI model on which the neuralgic points are identified: - interconnection points, in particular with third and public networks, - networks, subnets, in particular administration networks, - equipment providing security functions (filtering, authentication, encryption, etc.), - servers hosting data or ensuring sensitive functions; - The authorized network flow matrix specifying: - their technical description (services, protocols and ports); - business justification or technical infrastructure; - If necessary, when services, protocols or deemed not safe ports are used, the compensatory measures implemented, in the in -depth defense logic.

source_text: A cloud service providers' information policy is defined and maintained, and addresses the provision and use of its cloud services. Considerations around baseline information security requirements, multi-tenancy and cloud service customer isolation, access management, communication, lifecycle management of service customer accounts, and communication of breaches are included in the policy.

target_text: Insofar as a project affects or is likely to affect the level of service security, the service provider must warn the sponsor and inform him in writing of potential impacts, measures put in place to reduce these impacts as well as residual risks concerning him. IT service providers in clouds (SecnumCloud) - Date Date Version References Dispute Criterion Page

source_text: A cloud service providers' information policy is defined and maintained, and addresses the provision and use of its cloud services. Considerations around baseline information security requirements, multi-tenancy and cloud service customer isolation, access management, communication, lifecycle management of service customer accounts, and communication of breaches are included in the policy.
target_text: The service provider must document any violation of personal data and inform its sponsor. The violation must be notified to the CNIL5 if it presents a risk for the rights and freedoms of the persons concerned. It must be the subject of information to the persons concerned when the risk for their privacy is high.

source_text: [The Organization] communicates policy violations and policy non-compliance consequences to all [organizational] personnel on a regular basis.
target_text: The service provider must have an ethics charter integrated into the internal regulations, providing in particular that: - the services are provided with loyalty, discretion and impartiality and under conditions of confidentiality of the information processed; - staff only use the provider's methods, tools and techniques; - the staff undertake not to disclose information to a third party, even anonymized and decontextualized, obtained or generated within the framework of the service without the formal and written authorization of the sponsor; - Staff undertake to report to the service provider any manifestly illicit content discovered during the service; - Staff agree to comply with the national legislation and regulation in force and good practices related to their activities.

source_text: [The Organization] communicates policy violations and policy non-compliance consequences to all [organizational] personnel on a regular basis.

source_text: As part of its annual information security risk assessment, management selects and develops manual and IT general control activities that contribute to the mitigation of identified risks.

source_text: New hired personnel are required to pass a background screening check consistent with local jurisdiction as a condition of their employement.
target_text: The service provider must document and implement a procedure for verifying information concerning its staff in accordance with the laws and regulations in force. These verifications apply to any person involved in the provision of the service and must be proportional to the sensitivity or specificity of the information of the sponsor entrusted to the service provider as well as at the identified risks.

source_text: [The Organization] conducts screening and rescreening of authorized personnel for roles that require national security clearances. For national security clearances; a reinvestigation is required during the 5th year for top secret security clearance, the 10th year for secret security clearance, and 15th year for confidential security clearance. In addition, for law enforcement and high impact public trust level, a reinvestigation is required during the 5th year.

source_text: Passwords for in-scope system components are configured according to the Systems policy.

They must follow the recommendations of [G_AUTH].

source_text: User accounts are disabled after they have not been used for a period of two months or after a predefined number of failed login attempts. Locked user accounts are automatically removed after six months.

source_text: [The Organization] separates the administration interfaces made available to customers from those made available to its internal and external employees, and in particular: - The administration accounts under the responsibility of [The Organization] shall be managed using tools and directories that are separate from those used for the management of user accounts under the responsibility of the customer; - The administration interfaces made available to customers shall not allow for any connection from accounts under the responsibility of [The Organization]; - The administration interfaces used by [The Organization] shall not be accessible from the public network and as such shall not allow for any connection from accounts under the responsibility of the customer.

target_text: It is recommended to rely on the requirement benchmark for security incident detection providers [PDIS] for the implementation and exploitation of the analysis and correlation infrastructure of events.

source_text: Networks used by [The Organization] to migrate or create virtual machines are logically separated from other networks.
target_text: The service provider must implement appropriate partitioning measures between the service information system and its other information systems (office automation, management IT, building technical management, physical access control, etc.).

source_text: If virtual machines or containers are provided to customers, the cloud service provider must ensure: - Customers can restrict the selection of images of virtual machines or containers according to their specifications - Informs the customer of any changes made to previous virtual machine or container versions. - Images are hardened according to generally accepted industry standards.
target_text: The service provider must document and implement a procedure for managing the software environment configuration made available to the sponsor, in particular for their maintenance in security condition.

source_text: Where applicable, System components that store cardholder data (such as a database), including payment card collection devices are stored in an internal network zone, segregated from the DMZ and other untrusted networks. Access is strictly limited to authorized personnel.
target_text: The service provider must implement appropriate partitioning measures between the service information system and its other information systems (office automation, management IT, building technical management, physical access control, etc.).

source_text: The [The Organization] components are configured to use Universal Time Coordinated (UTC) and the clocks are synchronized with an external time source. The [The Organization] further provides cloud service customers, when applicable, information about how the customer can synchronize local clocks with the cloud service clock if applicable.
target_text: The service provider must document and implement a synchronization of clocks in all equipment on one or more internal sources of time coherent. These sources may themselves be synchronized on several external reliable sources, except for isolated networks.

source_text: Firewalls [or security groups] are used and configured to prevent unauthorized access to the production environment.
target_text: The service provider must partition, physically or by encryption, all internal data flows to the service information system vis-à-vis any other information system. When this partitioning is made by encryption, it is carried out in accordance with the requirements of chapter 10.2.

source_text: Firewalls configure and utilize a DMZ to limit inbound and outbound traffic to only system components that provide authorized publicly accessible services, protocols, and ports.
target_text: The service provider must take into account in risk assessment: - information management of the sponsor with different security needs; - the risks having impacts on the rights and freedoms of the persons concerned in the event of unauthorized access, unwanted modification and disappearance of personal data; - the risks of failure of the compartmentalization mechanisms of the resources of the technical infrastructure (memory, calculation, storage, network) shared between the sponsors; - the risks linked to the incomplete or unsecured erasure of data stored on memory or storage spaces shared between sponsors, in particular during the reallocations of memory and storage spaces; - the risks linked to the exposure of administration interfaces on a public network; - the risks of infringement of the confidentiality of the data of the sponsors by third parties involved in the provision of the service (suppliers, subcontractors, etc.): - the risks linked to natural and physical claims events; - the risks linked to the separation of tasks (see 6.2.a); - Risks linked to development environments (see 14.4.B). source_text: Production environments are segregated from non-production environments such as development and test environments.
target_text: Sensitive areas are reserved for the accommodation of the production system for the production of the service outside administration, operations and supervision.

source_text: Production environments are segregated from non-production environments such as development and test environments.
target_text: The service provider must document and implement the measures to physically separate the environments linked to the production of the service of other environments, including development environments.

source_text: Production environments are segregated from non-production environments such as development and test environments.
target_text: The service provider must document and implement, for the service information system, the partitioning measures (logic, physics or by encryption) to separate network flows according to: - the sensitivity of the information transmitted; - the nature of the flows (production, administration, supervision, etc.); - the field of belonging of flows (sponsors - with distinction by sponsor or set of sponsors, service provider, third parties, etc.); - The technical field (treatment, storage, etc.).

source_text: Production environments are segregated from non-production environments such as development and test environments.
target_text: The service provider must implement a secure development environment to manage the entire development cycle of the service information system.

source_text: [The Organization] restricts access to network services via wireless access points to authenticated users and services; approved wireless encryption protocols are required for wireless connections.
target_text: The service provider must partition, physically or by encryption, all internal data flows to the service information system vis-à-vis any other information system. When this partitioning is made by encryption, it is carried out in accordance with the requirements of chapter 10.2.

source_text: [The Organization] has network diagrams that are available to authorized personnel upon request.
target_text: The service provider must establish and keep up to date a cartography of the service information system, in connection with the asset inventory (see chapter 8.1), comprising at least the following elements: - The list of material or virtualized resources; - The names and functions of the applications, supporting the service; - the network architecture scheme at level 3 of the OSI model on which the neuralgic points are identified: - interconnection points, in particular with third and public networks, - networks, subnets, in particular administration networks, - equipment providing security functions (filtering, authentication, encryption, etc.), - servers hosting data or ensuring sensitive functions; - The authorized network flow matrix specifying: - their technical description (services, protocols and ports); - business justification or technical infrastructure; - If necessary, when services, protocols or deemed not safe ports are used, the compensatory measures implemented, in the in -depth defense logic.

source_text: [The Organization] is required to undergo a privacy assessment whenever new PII, new processing of PII or changes to existing processing of PII is planned. In addition, the assessment shall reviewed, updated and verified before a product is released for production, or annually if no changes in PII, its processing environment, or controls have occurred since the last assessment.
target_text: The service provider must carry out or contribute to the realization of an impact analysis relating to the protection of personal data when the processing is likely to generate a high risk for the rights and freedoms of the persons concerned (processing of particular categories of personal data as defined in [GDPR], processing of large -scale data, etc.). This analysis must include a legal evaluation of respect for fundamental principles and rights, as well as a more technical study of the technical measures implemented to protect people from risks to their privacy.

source_text: [The Organization] determines and securely maintain the necessary records in support of its obligations for the processing of PII.
target_text: The service provider must justify compliance with data protection principles for personal data processing implemented for their own account. He must justify the following points at least: - the purposes of the determined, explicit and legitimate treatments; - the traceability of processing activities on his behalf and that of his sponsor; - the lawful foundation of treatments; - the ban on the misappropriation of treatments; - the data used respect the principle of the minimum necessary and sufficient for treatments; Thus are adequate, relevant and limited; - the quality of the data used for maintained processing: exact and up -to -date data; - defined and limited conservation durations.

source_text: [The Organization] determines and securely maintain the necessary records in support of its obligations for the processing of PII.
target_text: The service provider must justify, for the processing of personal data implemented for his own account, the respect of the rights of the persons concerned. It must justify the following points at least: - user information via loyal and transparent processing; - The collection of users' consent: express, demonstrable and retrifiable; - the possibility for users to exercise the rights of access, rectification and erasure; - The possibility for users to exercise the rights to limit treatment, portability and opposition.

source_text: [The Organization] determines and documents their legal, regulatory and business obligations to PII principals (data subjects) related to the processing of their PII and provide the means to meet these obligations. These controls include but are not limited to:                                                                                                                       A) for notice regarding the processing of their PII or changes to the processing of their PII (including changes in sub-processors, if any) B) to modify or withdraw their consent (if consent is the lawful basis for processing the PII) C) objection of the processing of their PII D) restriction of the processing of their PII E) to access, correct and/or erase their PII F) retrieve in a secure manner their PII  they have provided [The Organization] in human and machine-readable formats G) to provide in a secure manner a copy of the PII that is processed H) to handle and respond to legitimate requests from PII principals for PII and provide the means to meet these obligations.
target_text: The service provider must identify the legal, regulatory and contractual requirements in force applicable to the service. In France, the service provider must at least consider the following texts: - personal data [law_il], [GDPR]; - professional secrecy [CP_ART_226_13], if necessary without prejudice to the application of article 40 paragraph 2 of the Code of Criminal Procedure relating to the report to a judicial authority; - breach of trust [CP_ART_314-1]; - the secret of private correspondence [CP_ART_226-15]; - involvement of privacy [CP_ART_226-1]; - fraudulent access or maintenance to an information system [CP_ART_323-1].

source_text: [The Organization] determines and documents their legal, regulatory and business obligations to PII principals (data subjects) related to the processing of their PII and provide the means to meet these obligations. These controls include but are not limited to:                                                                                                                       A) for notice regarding the processing of their PII or changes to the processing of their PII (including changes in sub-processors, if any) B) to modify or withdraw their consent (if consent is the lawful basis for processing the PII) C) objection of the processing of their PII D) restriction of the processing of their PII E) to access, correct and/or erase their PII F) retrieve in a secure manner their PII  they have provided [The Organization] in human and machine-readable formats G) to provide in a secure manner a copy of the PII that is processed H) to handle and respond to legitimate requests from PII principals for PII and provide the means to meet these obligations.
target_text: The service provider must, according to its role in the processing of personal data (controller, subcontractor or co-responsible) justify and document the choices of technical and organizational measures made in order to meet the protection requirements of personal data of this standard (see part 19.5).

source_text: [The Organization] either deletes PII or renders it in a form which does not permit identification or re-identification of PII principals, as soon as the original PII is no longer necessary for the identified purpose(s).  This includes temporary files created as a result of processing PII.
target_text: The service provider must implement means to ensure that the unsubscription of a user results in the deletion of all his access to the resources of the service system, as well as the deletion of his data in accordance with the registration and unsubscription procedure (see requirement 9.2 a)).

source_text: [The Organization] identifies decisions made by Systems based on the automatic processing of PII that can have a legal or similarly significant effect, so that Systems can get Customer/Controller's instruction on how to handle processing of PII to meet legal, contractual, policy, and regulatory requirements associated with automatic decision making that may have a legal or similarly significant effect on a PII Principal and do not occur without human review or approval of the Customer/Controller.
target_text: The service provider must identify the legal, regulatory and contractual requirements in force applicable to the service. In France, the service provider must at least consider the following texts: - personal data [law_il], [GDPR]; - professional secrecy [CP_ART_226_13], if necessary without prejudice to the application of article 40 paragraph 2 of the Code of Criminal Procedure relating to the report to a judicial authority; - breach of trust [CP_ART_314-1]; - the secret of private correspondence [CP_ART_226-15]; - involvement of privacy [CP_ART_226-1]; - fraudulent access or maintenance to an information system [CP_ART_323-1].

source_text: [The Organization] identifies decisions made by Systems based on the automatic processing of PII that can have a legal or similarly significant effect, so that Systems can get Customer/Controller's instruction on how to handle processing of PII to meet legal, contractual, policy, and regulatory requirements associated with automatic decision making that may have a legal or similarly significant effect on a PII Principal and do not occur without human review or approval of the Customer/Controller.
target_text: The service provider must, according to its role in the processing of personal data (controller, subcontractor or co-responsible) justify and document the choices of technical and organizational measures made in order to meet the protection requirements of personal data of this standard (see part 19.5).

source_text: For BU operating in France, procedures are in place to to identify and confirm compliance to applicable laws and regulations, specifically: - personal data [LOI_IL] [GDPR] ; - professional secrecy [CP_ART_226-13], where appropriate, without prejudice to the application of article 40 (2) of the Code of Criminal Procedure concerning reporting to a judicial authority; - abuse of trust [CP_ART_314-1] - the secrecy of private correspondence [CP_ART_226-15]; - breach of privacy [CP_ART_226-1] - fraudulent access to or maintenance of an information system [CP_ART_323-1].  Procedures would be available to clients upon request.

target_text: The service provider must document and implement the procedures to comply with the legal, regulatory and contractual requirements in force applicable to the service, as well as specific security needs (see requirement 8.3b)).

source_text: For BU operating in France, procedures are in place to to identify and confirm compliance to applicable laws and regulations, specifically: - personal data [LOI_IL] [GDPR] ; - professional secrecy [CP_ART_226-13], where appropriate, without prejudice to the application of article 40 (2) of the Code of Criminal Procedure concerning reporting to a judicial authority; - abuse of trust [CP_ART_314-1] - the secrecy of private correspondence [CP_ART_226-15]; - breach of privacy [CP_ART_226-1] - fraudulent access to or maintenance of an information system [CP_ART_323-1].  Procedures would be available to clients upon request.
target_text: The service provider must, at the request of a sponsor, make them accessible all of these procedures.

source_text: For BU operating in France, procedures are in place to to identify and confirm compliance to applicable laws and regulations, specifically: - personal data [LOI_IL] [GDPR] ; - professional secrecy [CP_ART_226-13], where appropriate, without prejudice to the application of article 40 (2) of the Code of Criminal Procedure concerning reporting to a judicial authority; - abuse of trust [CP_ART_314-1] - the secrecy of private correspondence [CP_ART_226-15]; - breach of privacy [CP_ART_226-1] - fraudulent access to or maintenance of an information system [CP_ART_323-1].  Procedures would be available to clients upon request.
target_text: The service provider must document and implement a process of active monitoring of the legal, regulatory and contractual requirements in force applicable to the service.

source_text: [The Organization] has a dedicated independent data protection officer who is responsible for following: - Reports to management all issues relating to PII - Act as a point of contact for supervisory authorities - Inform top-level management and employees of [The Organization] of their obligations regarding processing PII - Review and provide advice on privacy impact assessments conducted by organization.
target_text: The service provider must, when processing a large number of data, including special categories of personal data as defined in [GDPR], designate a data protection delegate.

source_text: [The Organization] has a dedicated independent data protection officer who is responsible for following: - Reports to management all issues relating to PII - Act as a point of contact for supervisory authorities - Inform top-level management and employees of [The Organization] of their obligations regarding processing PII - Review and provide advice on privacy impact assessments conducted by organization.
target_text: It is recommended that the service provider, regardless of the volume of personal data he processed, designates a data protection delegate.

source_text: [The Organization] has a dedicated independent data protection officer who is responsible for following: - Reports to management all issues relating to PII - Act as a point of contact for supervisory authorities - Inform top-level management and employees of [The Organization] of their obligations regarding processing PII - Review and provide advice on privacy impact assessments conducted by organization.
target_text: It is recommended that the service provider set up appropriate relations with the authorities competent in terms of information security and personal data and, if necessary, with the sectoral authorities according to the nature of the information entrusted by the sponsor to the service provider.

source_text: Relevant Parties are notified in a timely basis when breaches of PII occur (with details of the breach, consequences of the breach, and resolution taken to resolve the breach), or of any PII transfers between jurisdictions and of any intended changes in this regard.
target_text: The provider must, at the request of a sponsor, make him accessible the sanctions incurred in the event of an offense to the security policy.

source_text: Relevant Parties are notified in a timely basis when breaches of PII occur (with details of the breach, consequences of the breach, and resolution taken to resolve the breach), or of any PII transfers between jurisdictions and of any intended changes in this regard.
target_text: The service provider must document any violation of personal data and inform its sponsor. The violation must be notified to the CNIL5 if it presents a risk for the rights and freedoms of the persons concerned. It must be the subject of information to the persons concerned when the risk for their privacy is high.

source_text: [The Organization] determines respective roles and responsibilities for the processing of PII (including PII protection and security requirements) including when it is acting on behalf of itself (and does not require instruction from the Customer/Controller), when it is acting as proxy for the Customer/Controller (and does not require additional permission or instruction) and it requires instruction and permission from the Customer and ensure [The Organization] resources are appropriately trained.
target_text: The service provider must define and assign responsibilities in terms of personal data protection, consistent with its role in personal data processing (controller, subcontractor or co-responsible).

source_text: [The Organization] informs the customer/controller if, in its opinion, a processing instruction received from the customer/controller infringes applicable legislation and/or regulation.
target_text: When it acts as a subcontractor within the meaning of article 28 of [GDPR], the service provider must provide assistance and advice to the sponsor by informing him if an investigation of the latter constitutes a violation of the data protection rules.

source_text: Procedures are in place for customers to request access to their own log records. Upon request, [The Organization] provides access to the respective log records.
target_text: The service provider must provide, at the request of a sponsor, all the events concerning him.

source_text: A documented Privacy Information Security Management System Risk Assessment Methodology is in place that includes guidance on the identification of potential threats related to the processing of PII, rating the significance of the risks associated with the identified threats, and mitigation strategies for those risks, documentation and communication of those risks, as well as possible vulnerabilities within the cloud service provider and their impacts. Upper management, or its designated representative(s), owns this methodology and is responsible for its adherence.
target_text: The service provider must document an assessment of the risks covering the entire perimeter of the service.

source_text: A documented Privacy Information Security Management System Risk Assessment Methodology is in place that includes guidance on the identification of potential threats related to the processing of PII, rating the significance of the risks associated with the identified threats, and mitigation strategies for those risks, documentation and communication of those risks, as well as possible vulnerabilities within the cloud service provider and their impacts. Upper management, or its designated representative(s), owns this methodology and is responsible for its adherence.
target_text: The service provider must carry out its risk assessment using a documented method guaranteeing the reproducibility and comparability of the process.

source_text: A documented Privacy Information Security Management System Risk Assessment Methodology is in place that includes guidance on the identification of potential threats related to the processing of PII, rating the significance of the risks associated with the identified threats, and mitigation strategies for those risks, documentation and communication of those risks, as well as possible vulnerabilities within the cloud service provider and their impacts. Upper management, or its designated representative(s), owns this methodology and is responsible for its adherence.
target_text: The service provider must take into account in risk assessment: - information management of the sponsor with different security needs; - the risks having impacts on the rights and freedoms of the persons concerned in the event of unauthorized access, unwanted modification and disappearance of personal data; - the risks of failure of the compartmentalization mechanisms of the resources of the technical infrastructure (memory, calculation, storage, network) shared between the sponsors; - the risks linked to the incomplete or unsecured erasure of data stored on memory or storage spaces shared between sponsors, in particular during the reallocations of memory and storage spaces; - the risks linked to the exposure of administration interfaces on a public network; - the risks of infringement of the confidentiality of the data of the sponsors by third parties involved in the provision of the service (suppliers, subcontractors, etc.): - the risks linked to natural and physical claims events; - the risks linked to the separation of tasks (see 6.2.a); - Risks linked to development environments (see 14.4.B). IT service providers in clouds (SecnumCloud) - Date Date Version References Dispute Criterion Page

source_text: Security incident response policies and procedures are documented and communicated to authorized personnel.
target_text: The service provider must document and implement a procedure to provide rapid and effective responses to security incidents. These procedures must define the means and deadlines for the communication of security incidents to all the sponsors concerned as well as the level of confidentiality required for this communication.

source_text: Security incident response policies and procedures are documented and communicated to authorized personnel.
target_text: The service provider must inform its employees and all third parties participating in the implementation of the service of this procedure.

source_text: Privacy and human rights incident response policies and procedures are documented and communicated to authorized personnel.
target_text: The service provider must document and implement a procedure to provide rapid and effective responses to security incidents. These procedures must define the means and deadlines for the communication of security incidents to all the sponsors concerned as well as the level of confidentiality required for this communication.

source_text: Privacy and human rights incident response policies and procedures are documented and communicated to authorized personnel.
target_text: The service provider must inform its employees and all third parties participating in the implementation of the service of this procedure.

source_text: All events related to security, confidentiality, and availability are logged, tracked, and triggered on an on-going basis. When events are triggered as incidents, they are evaluated and resolved based on severity levels and communicated to affected parties by management until the [The Organization] has recovered from the incidents.
target_text: The service provider must document and implement a logging policy including at least the following elements: - the list of collection sources

source_text: All events related to security, confidentiality, and availability are logged, tracked, and triggered on an on-going basis. When events are triggered as incidents, they are evaluated and resolved based on severity levels and communicated to affected parties by management until the [The Organization] has recovered from the incidents.
target_text: The service provider must generate and collect the following events: - user activities related to information security

When events are triggered as incidents, they are evaluated and resolved based on severity levels and communicated to affected parties by management until the [The Organization] has recovered from the incidents.
target_text: The service provider must maintain events from the journalization for a minimum period of six months subject to compliance with legal and regulatory requirements.

When events are triggered as incidents, they are evaluated and resolved based on severity levels and communicated to affected parties by management until the [The Organization] has recovered from the incidents.
target_text: The service provider must provide, at the request of a sponsor, all the events concerning him.

source_text: All events related to security, confidentiality, and availability are logged, tracked, and triggered on an on-going basis. When events are triggered as incidents, they are evaluated and resolved based on severity levels and communicated to affected parties by management until the [The Organization] has recovered from the incidents.
target_text: The service provider must set up the horoditing of each journalized event.

source_text: All events related to security, confidentiality, and availability are logged, tracked, and triggered on an on-going basis. When events are triggered as incidents, they are evaluated and resolved based on severity levels and communicated to affected parties by management until the [The Organization] has recovered from the incidents.
target_text: The service provider must document and implement an infrastructure allowing the analysis and correlation of events recorded by the journalization system in order to detect events likely to affect the security of the service system, in real time or a posteriori for events going up to six months.

source_text: All events related to security, confidentiality, and availability are logged, tracked, and triggered on an on-going basis. When events are triggered as incidents, they are evaluated and resolved based on severity levels and communicated to affected parties by management until the [The Organization] has recovered from the incidents.
target_text: The service provider must pay the alarms reported by the infrastructure of analysis and correlation of events at least daily.

source_text: All events related to security, confidentiality, and availability are logged, tracked, and triggered on an on-going basis. When events are triggered as incidents, they are evaluated and resolved based on severity levels and communicated to affected parties by management until the [The Organization] has recovered from the incidents.
target_text: The service provider must have one or more security incident detection probes on the service information system. These probes must in particular allow the supervision of each interconnections of the service system system with third -party information systems and public networks. These probes must be sources of collection for the infrastructure of analysis and correlation of events (see chapter 12.9). source_text: All events related to security, confidentiality, and availability are logged, tracked, and triggered on an on-going basis. When events are triggered as incidents, they are evaluated and resolved based on severity levels and communicated to affected parties by management until the [The Organization] has recovered from the incidents.
target_text: The service provider must assess events related to information security and decide whether to qualify them as security incidents. For the assessment, he must rely on one or more scales (estimate, evaluation, etc.) shared with the sponsor. Note: Security incidents include violations of personal data.

source_text: All events related to security, confidentiality, and availability are logged, tracked, and triggered on an on-going basis. When events are triggered as incidents, they are evaluated and resolved based on severity levels and communicated to affected parties by management until the [The Organization] has recovered from the incidents.
target_text: The service provider must use a classification to clearly identify security incidents affecting data relating to the sponsors, in accordance with the results of risk assessment. This classification must include violations of personal data.

source_text: All events related to privacy and human rights are logged, tracked, and triggered on an on-going basis. When events are triggered as incidents, they are evaluated and resolved based on severity levels and communicated to affected parties by management until the [The Organization] has recovered from the incidents.
